name: interval
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: interval
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a period between two events or times

example.eg: We see each other at regular intervals - usually about once a month.
example.egtrans: 我们定期见面——通常大约是每月一次。

example.eg: The plants should be spaced at six-inch intervals.
example.egtrans: 这些植物应该以六英尺的间隔栽种。

trans_examp.trans_en: a short period between the parts of a performance or a sports event
trans_examp.trans_cn: （演出的）幕间休息；（体育比赛的）中间休息，中场休息

example.eg: There will be two 20-minute intervals during the opera.
example.egtrans: 歌剧演出中有两次20分钟的幕间休息。

example.eg: He scored his first goal of the match three minutes after the interval.
example.egtrans: 下半场刚开始3分钟，他就射入了他本场比赛的第一个进球。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: repeated after a particular period of time or a particular distance

example.eg: In the event of fire, the alarm will sound at 15-second intervals/at intervals of 15 seconds.
example.egtrans: 发生火灾时，警报每隔15秒就会响一次。

dsense.name: interval
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: the amount by which one note is higher or lower than another

example.eg: an interval of a fifth (= between one note and another one four notes higher)
